es.uam.eps.irg.rs.trec.eval.rec
Class AbstractTrecRecommenderEvaluator


java.lang.Object

  es.uam.eps.irg.rs.trec.eval.rec.AbstractTrecRecommenderEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
TrecRecommenderEvaluator
Direct Known Subclasses:
TrecRecommenderEvaluatorUsingAllItems, TrecRecommenderEvaluatorUsingTestAndNItems, TrecRecommenderEvaluatorUsingTestItems, TrecRecommenderEvaluatorUsingTestRatings, TrecRecommenderEvaluatorUsingTrainItems
public abstract class AbstractTrecRecommenderEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
implements TrecRecommenderEvaluator

Abstract class which implements a general evaluation methodology, by ranking the relevant and not-relevant items for each user.

setUserThreads


public void setUserThreads(int nThreads)
Sets the number of threads to be used when evaluating, one for each user. No threads are used by default, i.e., nThreads=0

Specified by:
setUserThreads in interface TrecRecommenderEvaluator
Parameters:
nThreads - number of threads to use, if nThreads < 1, no threads will be used

setRecommenderThreads


public void setRecommenderThreads(int nThreads)
Sets the number of threads to be used when evaluating, one for each recommender. No threads are used by default, i.e., nThreads=0

Specified by:
setRecommenderThreads in interface TrecRecommenderEvaluator
Parameters:
nThreads - number of threads to use, if nThreads < 1, no threads will be used

setWrappingRecommender


public void setWrappingRecommender(org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.recommender.Recommender r)
Recommender to be used when the evaluated recommender is not able to recommend some item for a user (i.e., it returns a NaN). It could be useful to ensure that all the recommenders are evaluated under the same conditions (every ranking has the same length). No wrapping recommender is used by default

Specified by:
setWrappingRecommender in interface TrecRecommenderEvaluator
Parameters:
r - recommender to use when the evaluated recommender fails to estimate some preference

setMaxRankingSize


public void setMaxRankingSize(int maxSize)
Sets the maximum length of the generated ranking. A value of 1000 is used by default

Specified by:
setMaxRankingSize in interface TrecRecommenderEvaluator
Parameters:
maxSize - maximum lenght of the ranking

getRelevantSet


protected java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> getRelevantSet(long userID)
Returns the set of relevant items for a particular user. By default it uses the output of #getRelevantMap(long), by returning the keySet of that map.

Parameters:
userID - user id
Returns:
set of relevant items for a user

getRelevantMap


protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Float> getRelevantMap(long userID)
Returns the map of relevant items for a particular user. The map contains items in the keys, and their corresponding relevance values in the values.

Parameters:
userID - user id
Returns:
the map of relevant items for a user, if userID is not in the test set, an empty map is returned

getNotRelevantSet


protected abstract java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> getNotRelevantSet(long userID)
Returns the set of not relevant items for a particular user. This method depends on each evaluation methodology.

Parameters:
userID - user id
Returns:
set of not relevant items for a user

getNotRelevantMap


protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.util.Set<java.lang.Long>> getNotRelevantMap(long userID,

                                                                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> items)
Returns the set of not relevant items for a particular user and a particular item. This method depends on each evaluation methodology. By default, it returns the same set of items for every relevant item for a user.

Parameters:
userID - user id
items - set of relevant items
Returns:
set of not relevant items for a user

writeQrelFile


protected void writeQrelFile(long userID,

                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Float> relMap,

                             java.lang.String qrelFile)

                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
A generic implementation for generating a qrel file. For each relevant item (#getRelevantMap(long)) a line in the file is included with the following pattern: userID \t 0 \t itemID \t relevanceValue

Parameters:
userID - user id
relMap - map of relevant items for a user
qrelFile - name of the file
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

writeRelevantItems


protected void writeRelevantItems(long userID,

                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Float> relMap,

                                  java.io.PrintStream ps)

                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
For each relevant item (#getRelevantMap(long)) a line in the file is included with the following pattern: userID \t itemID \t relevanceValue

Parameters:
userID - user id
relMap - map of relevant items for a user
ps - stream of the file
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

getOutputFolder


protected java.lang.String getOutputFolder()

writeRanking


protected void writeRanking(long userID,

                            java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> relSet,

                            java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.util.Set<java.lang.Long>> notRelMap,

                            java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Float> userItemPreferenceMap,

                            java.lang.String recName,

                            java.io.PrintStream writer)
A generic implementation for generating a ranking given a user and her list of preferences. For each preference included in userItemPreferenceMap (previously filled with values generated by some recommender) a ranking is generated. This ranking may contains less items than those in the union of relSet and notRelSet, if additional constraints are included (#setMaxRankingSize(int)). For each preference, a line is included in the file: userID \t Q0 \t itemID \t position \t preferenceValue \t r

Parameters:
userID - user id
relSet - set of relevant items for a user
notRelMap - map of not-relevant items for a user
userItemPreferenceMap - map containing the preferences inferred by some recommender for a user
recName - name of the recommender which generated set of relevant items for a user
writer - stream where the ranking will be written

addItemToRanking


protected static void addItemToRanking(long item,

                                       float pref,

                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.Float,java.util.Set<java.lang.Long>> preferenceMap)
Convenience method which encapsulates some trivial operations over the current map of preferences

Parameters:
item - current item
pref - preference towards an item (for some -unknown- user)
preferenceMap - mapping of preferences for some user

getFileName


public static java.lang.String getFileName(java.lang.String outFolder,

                                           java.lang.String recommenderName)
Default name for the file where the recommendations (in the form of rankings) will be generated. By default, it is simply outfolder "eval-" recommenderName ".txt"

Parameters:
outFolder - folder where the recommendation file will be generated
recommenderName - name of the recommender
Returns:
default name for the generated file
